content.question: Which of the following graphs is the most appropriate representation of the experimental data?

choices.label: The figure shows a bar graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled Treatment Group and the vertical axis is labeled Absorbance of 460 nanometer light. Five vertical shaded bars appear on the graph and are labeled, from left to right One, Two, Three, Four, and Five. Seven numbers appear on the vertical axis and are labeled, from bottom to top, zero point zero zero through zero point three zero zero, in increments of zero point zero five zero. The top of each shaded bar has a vertical error bar. The heights of the vertical shaded bars and their error bars are approximately as follows: Treatment Group One: Bar height zero point one six four, with error bar from zero point one three two, to zero point one nine six. Treatment Group Two: Bar height zero point one two five, with error bar from zero point zero two five, to zero point two two five. Treatment Group Three: Bar height zero point two one five, with error bar from zero point one eight one, to zero point two four nine. Treatment Group Four Bar height zero point two seven four, with error bar from zero point two five six, to zero point two nine two. Treatment Group Five: Bar height zero point zero nine five, with error bar from zero point zero nine one, to zero point zero nine nine.

The figure shows a line graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled Treatment Group and the vertical axis is labeled Absorbance of 460 nanometer Light. There are 5 data points on the graph connected by lines. There is a data point plotted for each Treatment Group, and each data point has a vertical error bar. The approximate y-axis coordinates of the data points and their error bars are as follows: Treatment Group One: data point at zero point one six four, with error bar from zero point one three two, to zero point one nine six. Treatment Group Two: data point at zero point one two five, with error bar from zero point zero two five, to zero point two two five. Treatment Group Three: data point at zero point two one five, with error bar from zero point one eight one, to zero point two four nine. Treatment Group Four: data point at zero point two seven four, with error bar from zero point two five six, to zero point two nine two. Treatment Group Five: data point at zero point zero nine five, with error bar from zero point zero nine one, to zero point zero nine nine.

The figure shows a pie chart divided into 5 sectors, which are identified by a key to the right of the pie chart. Starting with the upper rightmost sector and moving clockwise, the data are as follows:  Treatment group One, 18 point 8. Treatment group Two, 14 point three. Treatment group Three, 24 point six. Treatment group Four, 31 point 4. Treatment group Five, 10 point nine.

The figure shows a histogram. The horizontal axis is labeled Treatment Group and the vertical axis is labeled Absorbance of 460 nanometer Light. Seven numbers appear on the vertical axis and are labeled, from bottom to top, zero point zero zero through zero point three five zero, in increments of zero point zero five zero. Five vertical bars appear on the graph and are labeled, from left to right, One, Two, Three, Four, and Five. The heights of the vertical bars are approximately as follows: Treatment Group One, zero point one four three. Treatment Group Two, zero point one eight eight. Treatment Group Three, zero point three one four. Treatment Group Four, zero point two four six. Treatment Group Five, zero point one zero nine.

content.answer: The figure shows a bar graph in the first quadrant. The horizontal axis is labeled Treatment Group and the vertical axis is labeled Absorbance of 460 nanometer light. Five vertical shaded bars appear on the graph and are labeled, from left to right One, Two, Three, Four, and Five. Seven numbers appear on the vertical axis and are labeled, from bottom to top, zero point zero zero through zero point three zero zero, in increments of zero point zero five zero. The top of each shaded bar has a vertical error bar. The heights of the vertical shaded bars and their error bars are approximately as follows: Treatment Group One: Bar height zero point one six four, with error bar from zero point one three two, to zero point one nine six. Treatment Group Two: Bar height zero point one two five, with error bar from zero point zero two five, to zero point two two five. Treatment Group Three: Bar height zero point two one five, with error bar from zero point one eight one, to zero point two four nine. Treatment Group Four Bar height zero point two seven four, with error bar from zero point two five six, to zero point two nine two. Treatment Group Five: Bar height zero point zero nine five, with error bar from zero point zero nine one, to zero point zero nine nine.

skill.text: 4.B: Describe data from a table or graph, including: i. identifying specific data points ii. describing trends and patterns in the data iii. describing relationships between variables
